item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

cdata.text:
End Taxpayer Subsidies for Electric Vehicles Act

This bill eliminates the tax credit for the purchase of a qualified new clean vehicle. 

Under current law, a nonrefundable tax credit of up to $7,500 is allowed for the purchase of a vehicle that

  • is acquired new and for use by the taxpayer;
  • is made by a qualified manufacturer;
  • weighs less than 14,000 pounds;
  • is manufactured primarily for use on public streets, roads, and highways;
  • is powered significantly by an electric motor with a battery capacity of seven kilowatt hours or more;
  • is capable of being recharged from an external source of electricity; and
  • has final assembly occurring within North America.

bill.title: End Taxpayer Subsidies for Electric Vehicles Act

item.title: End Taxpayer Subsidies for Electric Vehicles Act
End Taxpayer Subsidies for Electric Vehicles Act
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the clean vehicle credit.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
